arm_group.description: The laparoscopic appendectomy was performed with three trocars, placed in the periumbilical area, right midabdomen, and forceps.
The open appendectomy was carried out in the standard way with McBurney muscle splitting incision (in supine position).

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of open and laparoscopic appendectomy

detailed_description.textblock:
Adult patients with presumptive diagnosis of acute appendicitis were prospectively
      randomized to either laparoscopic appendectomy or open appendectomy group during a
      three-year period (between 2007 and 2009).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients older than 16 years with presumptive diagnosis of acute appendicitis

        Exclusion Criteria:Appendectomy performed during diagnostic laparoscopy and incidental
        appendectomies patients with:

          -  cirrhosis

          -  ascites

          -  coagulation disorder

          -  diffuse peritonitis

          -  shock on admission

          -  large ventral hernia. Appendectomy performed during diagnostic laparoscopy and
             incidental appendectomies were also excluded

intervention.description: The laparoscopic appendectomy was performed with three trocars. Pneumoperitoneum was created using an open Hasson technique. The mesoappendix was divided using a harmonic scalpel or endoscopic tissue fusion device. The appendix was divided by placing one endoscopic loop and cut with harmonic scalpel. The specimen was removed through the umbilical port.
The open appendectomy was carried out in the standard way with McBurney muscle splitting incision (in supine position).

clinical_study.official_title: Laparoscopic vs. Open Surgical Procedure in Management of Acute Appendicitis

primary_outcome.measure: Cost of hospitalization based on the final hospital bills
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the beginning of the surgery till discharge from hospital (an expected average of 8 days, maximmum 20 days)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The number of doses of analgesics, and time from surgery to the last dose of analgesics.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the beginning of the surgery till discharge from hospital (an expected average of 8 days, maximmum 20 days)

secondary_outcome.description: No. of wound infection and intrabdominal abscesses.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during first 4 weeks after the surgery

secondary_outcome.description: No. of days from surgery to discharge of hospital
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the beginning of the surgery till discharge from hospital (an expected average of 8 days, maximmum 20 days)

secondary_outcome.description: No. of days from surgery to the resumption of clear liquid and regular diet
secondary_outcome.measure: Time until resumption of clear liquid and regular diet
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the beginning of the surgery to the resumption (an expected average 2 days after the surgery)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
